verses.name: Job 17:1
verses.text: My breath is corrupt, my days are extinct, the graves are ready for me.

verses.name: Job 17:2
verses.text: Are there not mockers with me? and doth not mine eye continue in their provocation?

verses.name: Job 17:3
verses.text: Lay down now, put me in a surety with thee; who is he that will strike hands with me?

verses.name: Job 17:4
verses.text: For thou hast hid their heart from understanding: therefore shalt thou not exalt them.

verses.name: Job 17:5
verses.text: He that speaketh flattery to his friends, even the eyes of his children shall fail.

verses.name: Job 17:6
verses.text: He hath made me also a byword of the people; and aforetime I was as a tabret.

verses.name: Job 17:7
verses.text: Mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, and all my members are as a shadow.

verses.name: Job 17:8
verses.text: Upright men shall be astonied at this, and the innocent shall stir up himself against the hypocrite.

verses.name: Job 17:9
verses.text: The righteous also shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.

verses.name: Job 17:10
verses.text: But as for you all, do ye return, and come now: for I cannot find one wise man among you.

verses.name: Job 17:11
verses.text: My days are past, my purposes are broken off, even the thoughts of my heart.

verses.name: Job 17:12
verses.text: They change the night into day: the light is short because of darkness.

verses.name: Job 17:13
verses.text: If I wait, the grave is mine house: I have made my bed in the darkness.

verses.name: Job 17:14
verses.text: I have said to corruption, Thou art my father: to the worm, Thou art my mother, and my sister.

verses.name: Job 17:15
verses.text: And where is now my hope? as for my hope, who shall see it?

verses.name: Job 17:16
verses.text: They shall go down to the bars of the pit, when our rest together is in the dust.
